result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Lavell Martin

records.addlTxt:
Branch 4 in jury trial. Case rescheduled. Parties in agreement of next court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lavell Martin in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Tommy Lavell Martin in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. COUNT 1 AND 2 AMENDED TO STRIKE/DISMISSED HABITUAL ENHANCERS. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 AND 2.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 3, 4, 5, AND 6 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed 6/27/22.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Court ORDERS defendant REMANDED. Any bond/bail held recompense.

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4 on 9/22/22 at 8:30 am
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests plea and sentencing. Parties agree upon next court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

. Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Tommy Lavell Martin not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorneys appeared by video means. Defense requests more time. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Tommy Lavell Martin not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set hearing. Court authorizes transfer of this case for global resolution to Branch 4. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lavell Martin in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Tommy Lavell Martin in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
No driving at all.

Defendant Tommy Lavell Martin in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Tommy Lavell Martin in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
